text: Answer: (b) Solution: An LR (1) parser traces a rightmost derivation in reverse. Here is a rightmost derivation of the string abedefg: S =A 1)S—A = aBE (2) A— aBE = aBeFG (6) E — ¢FG = aBeFg ®G—g = aBefg (NF—1 = abCDefg (3) B— bCD = abCdefg (5D —d = abedefg @Coc Thus the reductions are done in order 4, 5,3, 7, 8, 6, 2, 1 C—c, D—>d,B—bCD,F—f G-gE—gFGA—aBE, S—A
